data.title: wxCrafter now generates DebuggerGUI (fix toolbar bug on GTK+)
data.body:
The DebuggerGUI is now generated by wxCrafter instead of wxSmith.
It allows the toolbar to be rendered correctly under wxGTK.

data.title: Current platform not valid when loading a project
data.body: Because of the change of platforms name, the current platform (when the gd::Project is unserialized) is not valid (need a compatibility code).

data.title: Fix debugger and profiler graphical bug
data.body:
Fix a little mistake (using debugger instead of profiler).
And updating the AuiManager after that seems to completely fix the graphical glitch.

data.title: Name changed to "GDevelop"
data.body:
As discussed [here](http://www.forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=18&t=4947&p=45714#p45714), the software name is changing from "Game Develop" to **GDevelop** (easier to find with search engines, not used anywhere, it's shorter, sounds nice, is a shortcut for "Game Develop", and GD acronym can still be used).
@victorlevasseur if you have some time, could you check that everything seems ok with the change? I'll merge it soon, but if you have some time, do not hesitate to check out the branch, compile and see if everything seems ok. :smile:

data.title: Add custom tile's hitbox in the TileMapObject
data.body: I've added the possibility to edit the hitbox of each different tiles.

data.title: Fix the axis list in the Joystick selection dialog
data.body: Fix the axis list in the Joystick selection dialog : it adds AxisPovX and AxisPovY to replace AxisPOV.

data.title: PolygonEditionHelper to make polygon edition easier and more generic
data.body:
Here is the PolygonEditionHelper class which contains functions to make the polygon edition easier on a wxPanel (solve issue #18).
The SpriteObjectEditor has been adapted to use the capabilities of that new class.
(Just waiting for that PR to be merged to start working on the tile collision editor)

data.title: Fix bug with mono-bitmaps in TileMapObject
data.body:
Fix bug with mono-bitmaps in TileMapObject.
(I've also fixed the include in GDCpp/Polygon2d.cpp)

data.title: Add the doxyfile
data.body: You should add the doxyfile to the repository to make more easy to generate an offline documentation.

data.title: Change Polygon2d directory and add it to gd namespace
data.body:
I think the Polygon2d class is not at the good place in GDCore.
Maybe we can move it from GDCore/BuiltinExtensions/SpriteExtension to another directory. Which one ?
Then, we can move it into the gd namespace (even if it's used by GDCpp's games ?).

data.title: Re-Open Issue #17
data.body:
Accidentally i close my own issue, and cant re-open.

answer here, or re-open it

data.title: UTF8 support
data.body:
The idea is to create a simple gd::String class providing a string which supports utf8 internally (inside a standard std::string) so that GD would not have to deal explicitly with utf8 problems (such as string size, ...). As Darkhog mentionned, the utf-cpp library (http://utfcpp.sourceforge.net/) can be useful as it provide functions to deal with that encoding.
Utf8 is a good choice because it consumes less memory than Utf32 (used by sf::String) and is directly compatible with the first 128 chars of ASCII.

I don't have informations about how we can handle utf8 in javascript for the web platform, but I think it's managed directly inside.

data.title: Separate the polygon editor from the sprite editor
data.body:
Hi,
I've created that issue to discuss the way the polygon will be separated from the sprite editor.
For me, it can be made using a main class called, for example, PolygonEditor (maybe it's not a good idea of name as it's not a standalone editor, but an helper plugged to a wxPanel of wxScrolledWindow) or PolygonEditionHelper.
Then, the class will contain some functions that we will call from the Panel/ScrolledWindow using it : `DrawEditor(wxDC&, wxPoint offset)`, `OnLeftDownEvent(wxMouseEvent&)` to be called from the Panel when the left mouse button is pressed.
Also, the class will contain the polygon "treeview" editor (to be added manually to its AuiManager or automatically from the ctor ?)

data.title: [Sugestiion] Ask a Feature -Donations
data.body:
Instead of compare the price with the price of other things (29â‚¬ ( 39$ ) The price of: a nice T-Shirt)

You may put a system of:

0)The user
1)Ask a Feature
-then you see what is possible or not and put to votation

2)Vote on the features you want to get prioritized 

Features asked by donators get prioritized

You can either:
Sell more votes on the pool (which feature should get prioritized)
(the problem is, some people may create new acounts to get more votes instead of donate)

Sell "gold votes"  which get prioritized regardless of the amount of votes from non donators

And allow more votes from people who advertise your program (promotion link) but i recomend limit ths per users and during periods of time to avoid anoy with spam (and get ad'blocked) 

this will be an better incentive to donate.

This is the busines model i was planning for my own game engine and is simillar to synfing model.
but since your game engine is open source now, and will also be avaliable for making games on mobile, will be kind of useless to me make my own engine instead of contribute for this project.

data.title: License issues
data.body:
"The IDE (in the IDE folder) is licensed with GPL v3.
The Core library, the native and HTML5 platforms (respectively Core, GDCpp and GDJS folders) are LGPL v3."

If i create an game using this engine, the game will need to be open source/GPL v3?

data.title: TileMapObject
data.body:
Here is the first version of the TileMapObject.
It contains all the basic features like tilemap edition, predefined collision masks, changing tiles/texture at runtime.

I've just changed some files outside the Extensions/TileMapObject folder : 
- I've added GD_API to the PolygonCollision function (to be able to use it in the extension)
- Of course, I've added a line in the CMakeLists.txt to compile the extension

The extensions comes with a french translation, and two examples : a basic platformer using the tile map object and a basic level editor to show the runtime features of the object.

If you have some suggestions, I can still make some commits before you merge it.

data.title: ListsTestFuncExtraParameter (more flexibility for test functors)
data.body:
(Solution for #13)

These commits add ListsTestFuncExtraParameter which is an inheritable class to pass extra arguments to the test functor.
I've added some sub classes for the already existing functors.

Note : this is a solution to use TwoObjectListsTest for the TileMap Object.

data.title: Parameter conditionInverted always true for object's conditions
data.body:
Hi,

When I'm trying to use that special code-only parameter, my function always get "true" even if the condition isn't inverted. Notice that it's an object's condition (not like the standard collision condition which is a free condition).

data.title: Use directly wxWidgets under ExtLibs (Linux)
data.body: Why is this not possible de use directly wxWidgets from the Extlibs folder under Linux ?

data.title: Clarify "exclusive property"
data.body: I just want to point out this minor problem: license.txt says that the name and logo of Game Develop are "exclusive property of Florian Rival". This should be clarified. It sounds to me like it's saying that these are trademarks. If that's what it's supposed to say, it should say so explicitly, and it would also be preferable if it pointed to a trademark policy.

data.title: ImageManager : Image not found
data.body:
Inside the TileMap editor (not in an object), I'm trying to load a texture using that : 

```
game.GetImageManager()->GetSFMLTexture("myImage.png");
```

But it doesn't work for picture with relative path (the console prints "Image not found").

For the moment, the only thing I can do is loading the texture directly from a file but this source code is supposed to work in the editor but also in the scene (so I need ImageManager to work).

data.body: Huge and fantastic pull request. :)

data.title: Added basic unit tests for GDCore
data.body: Also fixed a serious memory leak involving events lists.

data.title: Add force clearing for GDJS
data.body:
This is a bug fix for http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=5451
Adds force clearing support in GDJS (replace the isTemporary boolean).

data.title: Fixed a compilation error with SetFullscreen.
data.body: Fixed a compilation error with SetFullscreen (http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=5428#p44324)

data.title: Support for C++11 with GCC 4.8.1 and WxWidgets 3.0.1
data.body:
I've made some changes to be able to compile GD with TDM-GCC 4.8.1 on Windows.
GD is now compiled using -std=gnu++11 and WxWidgets 3.0.1 needs also to be built with that flag (problems with Scintilla if only -std=c++11 is used).
Note : I've fixed the PNG icons because they were causing a lot of warnings with the new WxWidgets 3.0.1 (due to a new version of libpng).
